sponsor.partnerMessage: With the only MLS M8 Robotic Laser in a several state radius, OrthoLazer is leveraging the latest in technology to help folks in NWA reduce chronic and acute pain and inflammation along with treating arthritis, plantar fasciitis, fractures, and more. Learn more HERE.

posts.title: Cool Jobs in NWA
posts.content:
Looking for a job? Check out these positions posted to our community board:

  • The Jones Center is looking for a Senior Accountant
  • Arkansas Childrens Northwest has an RN position and an MRI Technologist position open

Have a job you're looking to fill? Post it here!

posts.title: Meet New Province Brewing Co's New Co-Owner
posts.content:
New Province Brewing Co. in Rogers, maker of favorite local flavors like the Space Suit Session Ale and the Philosopher King IPA, has a new co-owner who’s helping them brew up more than just delicious beers. 

  • Back in the beer game: John Lee, the former head brewer at Rebel Kettle, is getting back in the beer business and will serve as operations manager and brew alongside New Province’s head brewer, Kort Castleberry. 
  • All business…kinda: While his primary role will be seeking ways to grow the business through distribution, Lee is still a brewer at heart, and he’s already got a brew on the floor called the West Hudson, a hazy IPA brewed with Citra and T-90 hops. 

Read the full story on John Lee by the Arkansas Times HERE.

posts.title: Walmart and Sam’s Club Raised Over $1M For Arkansas Children’s Hospitals
posts.content:
If you noticed the opportunity to donate to Children’s Miracle Network Hospitals while checking out at Walmart or Sam’s Club earlier this summer, you’ll be happy to learn that this year's annual fundraiser collected more than $1m for Arkansas Children’s Hospitals.

  • For the kids: Across the US and Canada, Walmart and Sam’s Clubs annually raise funds through their stores to support local hospitals, specifically in the area of children’s health. Since 1987, the campaign has raised more than $1b for the 180 hospitals in the Children’s Miracle Network. 
  • Never too late: It's the collective generosity of NWA through campaigns like this that helped make Arkansas Children's Northwest a reality for our region. If you’d like to join in on the generosity, you’ve still got time. Visit helpkidslivebetter.org to make an online donation.

Read more on the story from Arkansas Children’s HERE.

posts.title: Weekend Roundup
posts.content:
Still trying to figure out your weekend plans? We've got you covered:

  • In the dark: Crystal Bridges is hosting Art Trail at Night tonight from 8-11p where you can enjoy making your own art and listening to some live music.
  • Saucy: Railyard Live has some great music coming to the Butterfield Stage this weekend with Arkansauce tonight and Interstellar Overdrive tomorrow.
  • Tradition: Check out the Decatur BBQ this Sunday. There will be a 5K, a car show, a parade and live music from Blane Howard.
  • First Friday: You know what that means. It's time for some fun in downtown Bentonville. There will be live music, back-to-school fun, and even a Twinkie eating competition.
  • Tax free: Don't forget that this weekend is Tax Free Weekend in Arkansas!
  • A classic: Tontitown Grape Festival is kicked off its 123rd year this week and has a weekend full of fun in the lineup.
  • Get going: Women of OZ is hosting its flagship MTB ride this weekend. There is a route for everyone on this ride, so both experienced and new riders can feel included.
  • Hey batter: Enjoy a Sunday with the kids at Arvest Ballpark. Kids eat free and can run the bases as the Naturals square off with the Drillers.

Have fun, stay safe, and we'll see you next week!

posts.title: House Party at the Fayetteville Public Library Tonight
posts.content:
Collier & Associates is hosting a House Party for the community at the Fayetteville Public Library, and you're invited!

  • Food and fun: There will be food from 641 Deli, frozen margaritas, and fun activities for the kids like airbrush face painting.
  • For a good cause: Additionally, there will be games, prizes and a raffle for an e-bike with proceeds going to the Fayetteville Public Library.

Join the crew at Collier & Associates on Aug 5 from 5-8pm at the Fayetteville Public Library for the House Party!
